ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Mood - Here you should try to indicate your mood, whether you have felt sad or gloomy.
Notes: 0 = I can be either cheerful or sad, depending on the circumstances; 0.5 = 0.5; 1 = I feel a bit low for the most part, though sometimes it eases up a little; 1.5 = 1.5; 2 = I feel thoroughly low and gloomy. Even things that normally cheer me up give me no pleasure; 2.5 = 2.5; 3 = I feel so utterly low and miserable, that I can imagine nothing worse

ElementDescription: Feelings of Unease - Here you should indicate to what extent you have had feelings of inner tension, uneasiness, anxiety, or vague fear, during the past week.
Notes: 0 = I feel calm for the most part; 0.5 = 0.5; 1 = I sometimes have unpleasant feelings of unease; 1.5 = 1.5; 2 = I am constantly plagued by feelings of uneasiness that can be very strong, and which I must make an effort to overcome; 2.5 = 2.5; 3 = I have dreadful, persistent or unbearable feelings of anxiety

ElementDescription: Sleep - Here you should indicate how well you sleep - how long you sleep, and how good your sleep has been for the past three nights.
Notes: 0 = I have no sleeping problems, and get as much sleep as I need. I have no difficulty falling asleep; 0.5 = 0.5; 1 = I have some sleeping problems. Sometimes it is hard to get off to sleep, or I sleep more lightly or restlessly than usual; 1.5 = 1.5; 2 = I sleep at least 2 hours a night less than usual. I wake often during the night, even if nothing has disturbed me; 2.5 = 2.5; 3 = I sleep very poorly, no more than 2-3 hours per night

ElementDescription: Appetite - Here you should indicate how your appetite has been, and try to recall whether it has differed in any way from normal.
Notes: 0 = My appetite has been the same as usual; 0.5 = 0.5; 1 = My appetite has been poorer than usual; 1.5 = 1.5; 2 = I have had almost no appetite at all. Food seems tasteless and I have to make myself eat; 2.5 = 2.5; 3 = I haven't felt like eating at all. I need persuading if I am to get anything down

ElementDescription: Concentration - Here you should try to indicate your ability to collect your thoughts, to concentrate on what you are doing.
Notes: 0 = I have no difficulty in concentrating; 0.5 = 0.5; 1 = Occasionally I find it hard to concentrate on things that I would usually find interesting (e.g., reading, or watching TV); 1.5 = 1.5; 2 = I find it particularly hard to concentrate on things that usually require no effort (e.g., reading, or talking with other people); 2.5 = 2.5; 3 = I am quite unable to concentrate on anything at all

ElementDescription: Initiative - Here you should try to assess your ability to get things done.
Notes: 0 = I have no difficulties starting new tasks; 0.5 = 0.5; 1 = When I have to get on with something, I find it more difficult than usual; 1.5 = 1.5; 2 = It requires great effort for me to get started on simple tasks that I normally perform more or less without thinking; 2.5 = 2.5; 3 = I cannot get stated with the simplest everyday tasks

ElementDescription: Emotional Involvement - Here you should assess your interest in your surroundings, in other people, and in activities that normally give you pleasure.
Notes: 0 = I am interested and involved in my surroundings, and this gives me pleasure; 0.5 = 0.5; 1 = I feel less strongly about things that normally arouse my interest. It is harder than usual to be cheerful, or to be angry when there is cause; 1.5 = 1.5; 2 = I feel no interest in my surroundings, not even for friends and acquaintances; 2.5 = 2.5; 3 = I no longer have any feelings. I feel painfully indifferent, even toward those closest to me

ElementDescription: Pessimism - Here you should consider how you view your future, and how you feel about yourself.
Notes: 0 = I view the future with confidence. On the whole I am quite satisfied with life; 0.5 = 0.5; 1 = Sometimes I am self-critical and think I am less worthy than others; 1.5 = 1.5; 2 = I brood over my failures and feel inferior or worthless, even if others may not agree; 2.5 = 2.5; 3 = Everything seems black to me, and I can see no glimmering of hope. I feel I am thoroughly useless, and that there is no chance of forgiveness for the awful things I have done

ElementDescription: Zest For Life - This item concerns your appetite for life, and whether you have felt listless and weary of life.
Notes: 0 = My appetite for life is normal; 0.5 = 0.5; 1 = Life doesn't seem particularly meaningful, though I don't wish I were dead; 1.5 = 1.5; 2 =  I often think it would be better to be dead, and though I don't really want to commit suicide it does seem a possible solution; 2.5 = 2.5; 3 = I am quite convinced that my only solution is to die, and I give a lot of thought to the best way to take my own life

ElementDescription: Total score for Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale-Self Report (MADRS-SR)
